::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module5_mcq_q67')" data-correct-answer="E">
<strong style="display: block;">Using the Fama-French-Carhart (FFC) four-factor model, compute the expected monthly return of a stock with:  
Rf = 0.4%, βm = 1.2, βSMB = 0.3, βHML = 0.2, βMom = 0.5.  
The factor premia are: E[Rm−Rf] = 0.6%, E[RSMB] = 0.4%, E[RHML] = 0.3%, E[RMom] = 0.5%.</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q67" value="A"> A. 1.2%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q67" value="B"> B. 1.3%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q67" value="C"> C. 1.4%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q67" value="D"> D. 1.5%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q67" value="E"> E. 1.6%</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module5_mcq_q67" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: E.  
E[R] = Rf + βm×(Rm−Rf) + βSMB×E[RSMB] + βHML×E[RHML] + βMom×E[RMom]  
= 0.4% + 1.2×0.6% + 0.3×0.4% + 0.2×0.3% + 0.5×0.5%  
= 0.4% + 0.72% + 0.12% + 0.06% + 0.25% = 1.55% ≈ 1.6%.
</div>

:::
